intro: Pleiosmilax vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis climbing fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound fronds. The plant features a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread and colonize various substrates. Its fronds are typically divided into numerous pinnae, giving it a lush, feathery appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
